text:
Just posting because it’s interesting
Weekly users stats and the stats for what versions most people are using.
<https://spin.d.pr/SEUYxZ+>

Most people are currently on 1.2.0
Meaning they are 5 minor versions behind.
Something to keep in consideration when releasing things the time to update extensions seems like it’s like it’s about 1 week, in some cases longer.

hmm, something to take in mind: our own stats :smile:
I have the dark theme branch active, if we don't merge the updates to the other branch that will create a diff.
so when I’m using a branch from git, I disable the published extension but I don’t uninstall it. So when I see disables I automatically assume 2 of them are us
and regarding the merging, I’ve been periodically merging your dark theme changes into the v103 branch
we’ll merge the v103 branch with master and publish it soon
just wanted to make sure everything in v1.03  worked first
not gonna lie, I think i have a good idea for the extension: <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/issues/94>
and it should be easy to implement
That could come before the tab detection one since it’s so simple
watch Boulter’s going to snag the idea and implement it a few days later, XD

alrighty going to try to get a little done on the extension <@U7ADCU3BM> if I get our fix in for the pop-up height, is there anything that I should wait to publish v1.03 for?

I’m going to try to do some thorough testing before publishing it
just a heads up I see we both did something for the “add widgets interface change, I’m going to take the best of both worlds on that if I can.

Your css before: <https://spin.d.pr/01sHuq+>
after my change: <https://spin.d.pr/l480n0+>

just felt the background color made it still feel like a module - just that it’s basically disabled.
figured out why I didn’t see your review show up right away, it’s hidden under the “all languages tab” It must think you were speaking spanish
